name: supersmart
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
extremely intelligent, or extremely good at thinking quickly or intelligently in difficult situations : My sister is super-smart; she has master's degrees in both public policy and comparative literature. He is a super-smart manager who always gets the best out of his players.
More examplesFewer examplesKnowing that she is a super-smart organiser, we let Martha plan most of the itinerary of our trip. The super-smart detective could easily identify holes in the suspect's alibi. Jill was not surprised to learn that her super-smart niece had got a place at Oxford University.
